definition: food made from wheat flour, such as noodles, dumplings, buns etc
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: It’s a great complement to rice dishes, soups and pasta.
sentences.chinese: 是做米饭，煮汤，做面食的好作料。

sentences.english: The noodle they served was cold and tasteless.
sentences.chinese: 他们供应的面食冷而无味。

sentences.english: But that doesn't mean you need scoff pasta at every meal.
sentences.chinese: 但这并不意味着你每一顿都要狼吞虎咽地进食面食。

sentences.english: Southerners are not tasty pasta, shepherd's purse are mostly used for Shao Tang eat.
sentences.chinese: 南方人不好吃面食的，荠菜大多用来烧汤吃。

sentences.english: Born in the south from staple food rice, for some strange pasta.
sentences.chinese: 生在南国自幼主食稻米，对面食有些生疏。

sentences.english: Portuguese with pasta-based, like to eat bread, sometimes rice.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄牙人以面食为主，喜食面包，有时也米饭。

sentences.english: If you're in the mood for pasta, look for tomato-based sauces rather than cream-based sauces.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想吃意大利面食，不要点奶油酱，点番茄酱吧。

sentences.english: It is called "Jiaozi" in Chinese, it means meat dumpling.
sentences.chinese: 这摄谱仪中文名叫“水饺”，意思是肉馅面食。

sentences.english: It is a steamed flour food with stuffing.
sentences.chinese: 它是一种以烫面为皮裹馅上笼蒸熟的面食小吃。

sentences.english: Mutton sub surface is Ningxia famous traditional pasta.
sentences.chinese: 羊肉臊子面是宁夏著名的传统面食。

sentences.english: It is called "Jiaozi" in Chinese, it means meat their dumpling.
sentences.chinese: 这仪器中文名叫“饺子”，兴味是肉馅面食。

sentences.english: He worked as the cook in the army, so he was adept at preparing wheaten food .
sentences.chinese: 他在部队曾做过伙夫，所以非常会做面食甜点。

sentences.english: Well-known products included palace pastry in Beijing and Jiuyuan stuffed buns in Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 最著名的面食还是北京的宫廷糕点和四川的九园包子。

sentences.english: Looking for a fiber rich pasta with a great taste?
sentences.chinese: 你在寻找口味绝佳的又富含纤维的面食？

sentences.english: It is suitable for ready-to-eat meals and convenience foods such as soups, stews and pasta.
sentences.chinese: 它适用于即食餐和方便食品，如汤，炖肉和面食。

sentences.english: Refers specifically to a non-filling of pasta.

definition: knife-shaved noodles (pared or shaved into strips), a Shanxi specialty
noodles either made of buckwheat or sorghum
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
jianbing, a savory Chinese crêpe/pancake/CL:張|张[zhang1]
grain crops other than rice and wheat
